item.title: Australian-born singer drops out of Russian-hosted Intervision song contest after 'political pressure'
item.description: Vassy dropped out of the contest at the last minute after coming under what Russian organisers said was "unprecedented political pressure from the government of Australia".

item.title: How Brisbane, Hawthorn, Geelong and Collingwood stay on top of the AFL world
item.description: The 21st century has been dominated by four AFL clubs — Geelong, Hawthorn, Collingwood and Brisbane — but there's no single secret to their success.

item.title: Penola High School's agriculture program revives community and enrolments
item.description: Cory O'Connor's three-week teaching placement turned around his hometown high school. Now he's receiving an award for the agriculture program he started there.

item.title: Pistachios are the latest food trend and a lot of work goes into predicting what's next
item.description: Pistachios have become the food flavour of the season, and a lot of work goes into predicting what the next big thing will be.

item.title: Cats star Tyson Stengle desperate to win second AFL premiership
item.description: Three years after Tyson Stengle capped off his remarkable AFL career resurrection with a premiership, the Geelong forward believes a second premiership would hold greater significance.

item.title: WA police investigate after man found with critical injuries dies on Kalgoorlie street
item.description: Detectives from the Major Crime Division are investigating the death near a popular park in the Goldfields city early on Sunday morning.

item.title: Penrith Panthers hammer Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs to keep NRL premiership five-peat hopes alive
item.description: Penrith has crushed Canterbury-Bankstown after a phenomenal first half to claim a 46-26 victory, keeping their hopes of a fifth-consecutive NRL premiership alive.

item.title: Optus CEO confirms further customer report calls, service outage at NSW-SA border.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Dayne Zorko fined by AFL for targeting Mason Cox's glasses in Lions' win over Magpies
item.description: Brisbane Lions stalwart Dayne Zorko is punished by the AFL after he ripped off Mason Cox's glasses during their fiery preliminary final clash.

item.title: Australia formally recognises state of Palestine as Anthony Albanese arrives in US
item.description: The historic decision foreshadowed last month has now become a reality, as Australia moves with Canada and the United Kingdom to join the growing list of countries to recognise Palestinian sovereignty.

item.title: Can recognising the state of Palestine achieve a two-state solution as Israel continues bombing Gaza?
item.description: While the Israel Defense Forces bomb Gaza and bulldoze the West Bank for settlements, moves to recognise Palestine in pursuit of a two-state solution may appear like something of a sick joke.

item.title: Is artificial intelligence overhyped or is AI the 'fourth industrial revolution'?
item.description: It's estimated 30,000 people are working in the AI industry in Australia, and fanfare is growing with start-ups tapping into billions of dollars of venture capital. Yet there are concerns about hype and a lack of regulation.

item.title: Older Australians to pay up to $50/hour for basic care at home under aged care changes
item.description: Older Australians entering the aged care system will have to pay for "non-clinical" services such as showers and help with medication under wide-ranging changes taking effect in November.

item.title: Brownlow Medal 2025 — when is it, how to watch and who are the favourites for AFL's best-and-fairest award
item.description: The AFL's big night is here, as the league's best and fairest player is honoured with the Brownlow Medal. Here is everything you need to know about the big event.

item.title: The government says its 2035 climate targets are achievable but mathematics suggests a different story
item.description: The problem with an emissions reduction target is that its mere existence implies it is achievable and that if we do achieve it, we will be fine. The truth is more complex.

item.title: Lachlan Murdoch involved in possible TikTok deal, Donald Trump says
item.description: The deal would see TikTok's American assets transferred from China's ByteDance to American owners.

item.title: Dementia-linked protein lower in people reporting vigorous exercise, study finds
item.description: Scientists have, for the first time, linked exercise with a particular protein in the blood that is associated with brain health.

item.title: Donald Trump calls Charlie Kirk a 'martyr' at memorial service, widow Erika Kirk forgives alleged assassin
item.description: US President Donald Trump says Charlie Kirk was a "martyr to American freedom", while his widow says she forgives his alleged assassin during a memorial to the right-wing activist.

item.title: Storm-damaged turbine at NSW Central West wind farm raises safety concerns
item.description: After a wind turbine blade snapped in half during a storm, the NSW National Party has called for a safety audit into the renewable technology.

item.title: This program could be the blueprint for helping kids fleeing domestic violence stay off the streets
item.description: Every night, thousands of Australian kids are homeless without an adult to look after them.

item.title: NT police data shows violent crime increasing, property crime decreasing
item.description: NT police data show crime rates in the NT are moving in two directions, with violent crime increasing and property crime decreasing.

item.title: Protesters in Philippines clash with police in rallies against corruption
item.description: Thousands of Filipinos marched in the capital to vent their anger over a ballooning scandal involving bogus flood-control projects believed to have cost taxpayers billions of dollars.

item.title: Optus triple-0 outage investigation underway as minister warns of 'consequences'
item.description: The Australian Media and Communications Authority begins its investigation into the Optus triple-0 outage that has been linked to multiple deaths in South Australia and Western Australia.

item.title: Jacqui Lambie calls on independent MLCs to 'block' the proposed Macquarie Point stadium
item.description: Senator Jacqui Lambie tells the independents in Tasmania's upper house — who hold the fate of the Macquarie Point stadium in their hands — to "find the courage the premier can't" and stop the project.

item.title: 'Turning it up to eleven': Spinal Tap returns
item.description: The new film follows the fictional heavy metal band reuniting for one final gig with cameos from Elton John and Paul McCartney.

item.title: Easy and healthy dinner recipes for spring
item.description: If you're looking for light dinner ideas as the weather warms up, we have plenty of easy options. Think veggie-filled frittatas and beef taco bowls with a few healthy swaps.

item.title: NT Police complete Kumanjayi White death in custody autopsy, with brief of evidence handed to prosecutors
item.description: The autopsy into the Aboriginal man's death in custody in Alice Springs has been completed, with the police brief of evidence handed to prosecutors to determine whether any charges should be laid.

item.title: Australian pair Holly Harris and Jason Chan qualify for ice dance at 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: Australian pair Holly Harris and Jason Chan finish second at the Skate to Milano event in Beijing to book their spot at the Milan-Cortina Olympic Games in February next year.

item.title: Is AI impacting your career or life plans? Has its rapid rise got you rethinking your future? The ABC wants to hear from you
item.description: Whether you’re a student halfway through a degree or a mid-career manager planning the next five years, artificial intelligence (AI) is reshaping lives across the country. If you've been feeling its effects, the ABC wants to hear from you.

item.title: Masood Zakaria asks court to permanently stay his murder trial over 'unlawful' deportation from Türkiye
item.description: A major Sydney murder trial is at risk of falling over as a Supreme Court judge ruled there was evidence the man charged was deported back to Australia unlawfully.

item.title: Geelong star Max Holmes admits missing 2022 grand final hurt relationship with coach Chris Scott
item.description: Geelong speedster Max Holmes is desperate to put his previous grand-final week anger and heartbreak behind him as the Cats eye AFL premiership glory.

item.title: Super Netball's Sunshine Coast Lightning enters new Global Sports Fund Management Group ownership
item.description: Almost a decade after being co-founded by the Melbourne Storm and University of the Sunshine Coast, Super Netball's Lightning is entering a new era.

item.title: Endangered Littlejohn's tree frog finally bred in captivity amid habitat threat
item.description: Scientists have achieved a breakthrough in their work to save the Littlejohn's tree frog species which only exists in three isolated regions in New South Wales.

item.title: Brownlow Medal 2025: All the best fashion looks from AFL's night of nights
item.description: Just after the fashion from this evening's Brownlow Medal? We've got you.

item.title: Matt Rowell wins 2025 Brownlow Medal as Gold Coast star beats out Nick Daicos and Bailey Smith
item.description: Matt Rowell becomes the second Gold Coast player to win the prestigious AFL award, as a questionable voting call regarding Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera leaves the room stunned.

item.title: Bathurst childcare worker charged over alleged common assault of 4yo
item.description: Police allege the 18-year-old educator dragged a four-year-old boy by the arm and threw him on a mattress at a childcare centre in Bathurst earlier this year.

item.title: More than $4 million in drugs seized across WA's far north in ongoing operation
item.description: Police in the Kimberley say an ongoing investigation has seized millions of dollars' worth of ammunition, methylamphetamine and other drugs.

item.title: Ley writes to Republicans vowing to revoke Palestine recognition ahead of Albanese's UN address
item.description: In an unorthodox move, Opposition Leader Sussan Ley writes to a group of Republicans reassuring the Coalition would withdraw recognition of Palestine, ahead of a major United Nations address to be delivered by the prime minister.

item.title: Moldovan authorities arrest 74 people over alleged Russia-backed election plot
item.description: The widespread raids came ahead of the country's parliamentary elections on Sunday, expected to determine whether the country will pursue closer ties with the European Union.

item.title: Artificial intelligence to dominate Australia's future economy, but who will reap the benefits?
item.description: From robots to supercomputers, artificial intelligence is set to become an integral part of the Australian economy, with tens of billions in benefits to be gained … but for whom?

item.title: Myanmar junta revoking citizenship of actors, singers and other celebrities
item.description: Myanmar's military junta is using citizenship as a weapon, targeting political opponents, activists and even celebrities who speak out against the regime.

item.title: Doctors concerned easily accessible illegal cigarettes are causing smoking rates to increase
item.description: Doctors say smoking rates are at levels they haven't seen in a decade due to easy access to illegal cigarettes that are a "quarter of the price" of legal cigarettes.

item.title: Dash camera mandate for WA driving instructors considered as part of regulation review
item.description: The WA government is considering mandating the use of dash cameras for driving instructors, in a bid to better protect vulnerable student drivers.

item.title: Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera being robbed overshadowed Matt Rowell's Brownlow Medal win, and could change the voting process forever
item.description: It is not often that the AFL's night of nights gets hijacked by a moment not involving the winner of the Brownlow Medal. This is exactly what took place when Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera was seemingly robbed in broad daylight.

item.title: Bushfire survivors still camping years later amid construction backlog
item.description: Five years after devastating bushfires swept through Mallacoota, some survivors are still making do with tents and camp kitchens amid a backlog of construction jobs.

item.title: Paddleboarder gets too close to whales to film them, gets nudged away
item.description: Drone footage shows a paddleboarder getting too close to film a southern right whale mother and calf, and being nudged away by the whale, off Point Ann.

item.title: Women band together to create community for rural mums feeling lonely
item.description: After raising biological and foster children on a farm 60 kilometres from the nearest major town, Tracey Angwin says being part of a community is essential for rural mums.

item.title: NSW police suspend investigation into murder of homeless man Reginald Mullaly
item.description: Police have suspended an investigation of a homeless man's brutal murder in Bathurst a decade ago, prompting a fresh plea from his family for information.

item.title: Deeming rates have increased after a five-year freeze. Here's how that could impact pension payments
item.description: The changes impact people on Centrelink payments who earn an income from financial assets, but pensioners are the biggest group to be affected.

item.title: NSW Police officer charged with assault over protest arrest of former Greens candidate Hannah Thomas
item.description: Hannah Thomas was among a group of pro-Palestinian protesters who demonstrated outside a manufacturing facility in June when she sustained a serious eye injury during her arrest for failing to comply with a move on direction.

item.description: One sleepless resident said he drove around his local area to find the source of the disturbance.

item.title: Historic war ledger stolen from Toowoomba church before Carnival of Flowers
item.description: After being on display for more than a century, a handwritten ledger of local soldiers who gave their lives during World War I and World War II has been stolen from a Toowoomba church.

item.description: Donald Trump's advice that pregnant women should limit the use of paracetamol in pregnancy has been criticised as "baseless". So what does it mean for you?

item.title: Man accused of hitting 42yo with vehicle in Kalgoorlie appears in court
item.description: A 29-year-old man has faced court today after detectives from WA Police's Homicide Squad charged him with murder, two days after the death of a man in the state's Goldfields.

item.title: Hakyung Lee found guilty over deaths of children found in Auckland storage unit suitcases
item.description: Hakyung Lee admitted to giving her two children an overdose of prescription medicine before changing her name and leaving New Zealand.

item.description: Sharks star Siosifa Talakai gives an insight into the heated player meetings that came during Cronulla's mid-season slump before the team's spectacular charge to an NRL preliminary final.

item.description: Police charge a 15-year-old boy with the murder of Dau Akueng, also 15, who was found with fatal injuries alongside his 12-year-old friend Chol Achiek in Melbourne's outer west earlier this month.

item.description: Pro-democracy activist Alaa Abd el-Fattah has been released from prison, following a pardon from the Egyptian president.

item.title: Vanuatu plans to sign police deal with China while Nakamal pact with Australia is left hanging

item.description: A scathing report into Sydney Trains has put a "disturbing" spotlight on the "absence of effective communications" and "information voids" on the network, but one transport expert says this was not always the case.

item.description: Cedric and Noelene Jordan's attempt to overturn their conviction for the murder of their former son-in-law in 2009 has failed, with the Court of Criminal Appeal rejecting it on all grounds.

item.description: Thousands of bees appear without warning in the regional city, alarming locals and causing a commotion.

item.description: The estimated cost of the invasive khapra beetle to Australia's grains industry could be more than $15 billion if it became endemic across the country after being discovered in imported nappy pants.

item.title: Teenage girl to stand trial for alleged Hervey Bay caravan park murder

item.description: Foreign Minister Penny Wong says the speech US President Donald Trump delivered at the UN is simply more of the same from him and "consistent" with his views and actions since being elected for a second term.

item.title: Former A-League footballers Clayton Lewis and Kearyn Baccus sentenced over betting scam
item.description: Both players were paid $10,000 each to intentionally get themselves yellow cards while playing for Macarthur FC against Sydney FC to influence overseas bets on the game.

item.title: Farmer Sam Bailey, who worked to be the world's first quadriplegic helicopter pilot, dies
item.description: A "true blue" farmer, pilot, and pioneer for accessibility in agriculture has been honoured after his sudden death.

item.title: Former police officer Stephen Michael Calcutt pleads guilty to filming teenagers in shower and up skirt
item.description: The former sergeant also filmed up another teenager's skirt and had a number of cartoons depicting children in sexual situations on a hard drive.

item.title: Brisbane Lions trust Lachie Neale to make right call ahead of AFL grand final
item.description: All eyes are on Lachie Neale's bid to make a remarkable grand final return from injury, and his teammates will back him to make the right call.

item.title: Murder trial hears final arguments from trio accused of 2022 stabbing death of David Jenkins
item.description: The trial of two brothers and another man accused of the stabbing murder of a man in Tasmania's north in 2022 hears there is "no serious dispute" that Luke Shaw "was the person who killed" David Jenkins.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Men sentenced for riot amid 'pressure cooker' conditions in Alice Springs prison
item.description: Lawyers for nine Alice Springs prisoners who rioted at the facility last year say the unrest was akin to a "pressure cooker release valve" amid "feelings of degradation and neglect".

item.title: South Bunbury Football Club apologises for president's Charlie Kirk party costume
item.description: A West Australian football club issues a public apology after photos emerge of its president in a Charlie Kirk costume, featuring a gunshot wound to the neck.

item.title: Top stories from ABC News
item.description: Listen to ABC News interviews and commentary and analysis from radio programs like AM, PM and The World Today.

item.title: Gaza aid flotilla targeted by drone explosion
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Italy sends navy frigate to assist Global Sumud Flotilla after vessels targeted by drones off Greece
item.description: The flotilla carrying aid and pro-Palestinian activists said they heard explosions and saw multiple drones that targeted some of their boats.

item.title: Super Typhoon Ragasa hits south China as death toll rises to 14
item.description: Super Typhoon Ragasa has killed at least 14 people in Taiwan as it struck the southern Chinese coast.

item.title: One dead in 'targeted' shooting at Dallas immigration centre, DHS says
item.description: Police were first alerted to the incident at 6:40am on Wednesday, local time, and later found the shooter on a nearby roof dead from an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound.

item.title: London mayor calls Trump racist, sexist and Islamophobic, hitting back at US president's 'sharia law' comments
item.description: The US president described Sadiq Khan as "terrible" and warned the British capital was heading towards "sharia law".

item.title: Kimmel monologue racks up millions of views on social media as Joe Rogan slams government 'dictating'
item.description: Kimmel's program was indefinitely suspended last week after he made comments about the late conservative commentator Charlie Kirk.

item.title: Australia's social media ban wins praise from Europe at UN event
item.description: Australia's willingness to take on the social media giants is drawing significant international interest, winning the support of the European Commission president at a forum in New York.

item.title: Who is really pulling the strings at Optus and what does that mean for you?
item.description: The Singapore government's sovereign wealth investment vehicle is majority-owned by Singtel, which owns Australia's second-largest telco provider.

item.title: University of Technology Sydney under investigation by National Student Ombudsman over gender-based and sexual violence policies
item.description: The National Student Ombudsman is investigating allegations UTS failed to improve its response to sexual harm and gender-based violence despite four reviews since 2022.

item.title: Andrew Hastie taunted over claim that high immigration is making Australians 'strangers in our own home'
item.description: The home affairs minister says Andrew Hastie should name which visa classes he would cut after the shadow home affairs minister suggested "unsustainable" immigration was making Australians "feel like strangers in our own home".

item.title: Federal politics live: PM bids for UN Security Council seat in major address
item.description: Australia will make a bid for a seat on the UN Security Council, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has told a meeting of the UN General Assembly. Follow live.

item.title: AFL super fans prepare for the grand final clash between Geelong and Brisbane
item.description: From a unique tattoo to a personalised burger, the AFL grand final is more than just a game for these super fans.

item.title: Will food prices ever come down? Don't bet on it
item.description: While recent cuts to interest rates may have given mortgage holders a bit of a financial breathing space, the cost of food continues to creep upwards.

item.title: Zelenskyy blames Putin for 'most destructive arms race in human history'
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Tasmanian horse breeder says she will rehome more than 100 animals after social media outcry
item.description: A Tasmanian horse breeder has been told to reduce the number of horses on her property and rehome them, after concerns were raised by members of the racing community.

item.title: Independent review launched into Australia's fire ant eradication program amid warnings of a 'closing window of opportunity'
item.description: Authorities launch an independent review of Australia's national fire ant eradication program to evaluate the country's fight against one of the world’s most destructive pests.

item.title: Families demand inquiry into NSW Police handling of missing persons cases
item.description: Nikii Smith is one of 10,000 people who signed a petition calling for a NSW inquiry into the handling of missing persons cases.

item.title: China retains narrow edge over US as South-East Asia's most influential partner
item.description: New research shows that China retains a very narrow edge over the United States as South-East Asia's most influential partner, with experts predicting it will soon pull further ahead as the Trump administration's policies begin to bite.

item.title: Solar, batteries and the 'phone charger dilemma': How a standards gap threatens clean tech
item.description: In the same way Apple and Samsung used different phone chargers, many clean tech products are not compatible with others. Experts say it is a big problem for the energy transition.

item.title: Super Typhoon Ragasa leaves trail of destruction in Hong Kong, mainland China
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Family calls for change amid frustration at seven-year coronial inquest wait
item.description: Robert Hall was killed when he was struck by partially blind driver John Charles Robertson on the Horrocks Highway in 2018. It has been a long wait for the family ahead of the release of coronial findings into his death next month.

item.title: Victim-survivors left to self-represent in Family Court of Australia proceedings due to legal fees
item.description: Jacinta says she is part of a "big wave" of litigants self-representing in Family Court of Australia proceedings after facing extraordinary fees from family law firms.

item.title: Australia wins mixed relay gold medal at UCI Road World Championships
item.description: Australia has retained its title in the mixed team relay at the UCI Road World Championships as it stormed to victory over two circuits of a hilly 20.9-kilometre course in Kigali on Wednesday, local time.

item.title: Elevated E. coli levels recorded at major NT crocodile farm owned by luxury label Hermès
item.description: One of Australia's largest crocodile farms, owned by a subsidiary of luxury label Hermès, is consistently irrigating with water containing E. coli concentrations almost 500 times the national guidelines.

item.title: Police launch fresh search of WA outback over Ray and Jennie Kehlet cold case
item.description: Detectives are this week revisiting the site in WA's outback where the body of prospector Ray Kehlet was found. His wife Jennie is still missing.

item.title: Former AFL boss Andrew Demetriou insists league would embrace a gay men's player
item.description: Former AFL boss Andrew Demetriou says the public would embrace a gay men's player and rejects that the AFL is an unsafe environment.

item.title: Indigenous teen speaks out against heckling of Welcome to Country
item.description: An Indigenous high school student's essay on the Anzac Day heckling of an Indigenous elder by far-right supremacists has earned her a nationally recognised award.

item.title: New gene therapy for Huntington's 'changes everything', say researchers
item.description: Clinical trials of a groundbreaking new gene therapy for Huntington's disease have shown that it slows progression of the condition by 75 per cent after three years, researchers say.

item.title: Alexa Leary and Callum Simpson win gold medals for Australia at World Para Swimming Championships in Singapore
item.description: Alexa Leary's win in the final individual event of Wednesday night's action in Singapore bookended a golden night for Australia after Callum Simpson won gold in the first event of the evening.

item.title: Magnitude-4.1 earthquake rattles Tasmania from Maydena to Hobart
item.description: Tasmania records a magnitude-4.1 earthquake in the state's south-west that was felt from Maydena to Hobart.

item.title: Live market updates: Macquarie to compensate Shield investors, share markets fall as traders dial back rate cut bets
item.description: Corporate regulator ASIC reaches a deal with Macquarie to fully compensate investors in the collapsed super fund Shield. Meanwhile, major share indices are easing on worries that interest rates will not fall much further. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Wells meets with Singaporean officials but fails to mention Optus triple-0 outage
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Who is Samoa's new prime minister, Laaulialemalietoa Polataivao Fosi Schmidt?
item.description: Supporters are fervent in their enthusiasm for Samoa's new prime minister, but voters who are more sceptical of Laaulialemalietoa Polataivao Fosi Schmidt, question his motives.

item.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy warns UN of 'the most destructive arms race in human history'
item.description: Ukraine's president calls for global action to regulate the twin threats posed by drone technology and artificial intelligence, warning "no-one can feel safe" from Russia's expansionist goals.

item.title: AFL grand final sprint won't feature all teams, as Gout Gout and Harry Garside to feature at the MCG
item.description: The AFL announces that only seven AFL players will run in the traditional grand final sprint, with Olympic boxer Harry Garside also joining in.

item.title: China's President Xi Jinping announces new climate goal to cut emissions by 2035
item.description: Outlining China's new carbon targets in a video link to the UN climate conference in New York, President Xi Jinping says "green and low carbon transition is the trend of our time".

item.title: Nottingham Forest draws 2-2 with Real Betis in opening UEFA Europa League match
item.description: Nottingham Forest's long-awaited return to European competition ends 2-2 at Real Betis, with Igor Jesus's first-half double cancelling out by a late Antony strike.

item.title: Lawn bowls championship puts small border town of Barham on the sporting map
item.description: It may not seem like the place to host a prestigious World Bowls competition, but a small Murray River town is doing just that.

item.title: ARIA Award nominations 2025: Ninajirachi, Dom Dolla, Amyl & The Sniffers lead the pack
item.description: All the contenders are hopefuls vying for ARIA Awards glory at the music industry's glitzy ceremony, taking place next month.

item.title: Peter Tonagh to replace Catherine West as Nine's chair
item.description: He replaces Catherine West, who spent 18 months in the position.

item.title: New stats reveal highest number of criminal incidents in Victoria since records began
item.description: The latest figures from Victoria's Crime Statistics Agency show the highest number of criminal incidents in at least two decades.

item.title: Massive sinkhole disrupts traffic and power supply in central Bangkok
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Bathurst mother speaks of hardships of losing daughter to cyber bullying
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Dramatic footage shows sinkhole swallowing up road in central Bangkok
item.description: Social media footage shows powerlines being pulled down into the 50-metre deep hole and vehicles teetering on the edge.

item.title: Andrea James to lead Ilbijerri Theatre Company as artistic director Rachael Maza steps back
item.description: Andrea James will take the helm of Australia's oldest Indigenous theatre company Ilbijerri, as outgoing artistic director Rachael Maza steps back after almost 18 years.

item.title: Man to be charged with 'serious offences' over domestic violence incident and pursuit, police say
item.description: South Australia Police says a Vale Park man has been arrested following a pursuit that led STAR group officers and police negotiators to a unit in Adelaide's western suburbs.

item.title: NT para athlete Briseis Brittain wasn't born when Cathy Freeman won Olympic gold, but the moment fired a dream
item.description: Arnhem Land teenager Briseis Brittain is set to represent Australia at the World Para Athletics Championships in New Delhi this month, competing in the 200m and 400m races.

item.title: Liberal candidate Gisele Kapterian abandons court challenge for Sydney seat of Bradfield
item.description: Gisele Kapterian abandons her court action challenging the election result in the federal Sydney seat of Bradfield.

item.title: Anthony Albanese addresses UN on climate goals, Gaza and Australia's security council bid
item.description: The prime minister uses his UN speech to talk up Australia's emissions plan after Donald Trump called climate change a "con job", and confirms Australia is still seeking a temporary seat on the body's security council.

item.title: Nicho Hynes shrugs off personal barbs ahead of NRL preliminary final between Melbourne and Cronulla
item.description: Accused by some of being too nice and not nice enough by others, polarising Cronulla star Nicho Hynes "doesn't give a rats" about criticism that comes his way anymore.

item.title: Figure skating star scraps program amid probe involving artist who co-wrote music
item.description: Figure skaters spend months perfecting their programs ahead of big competitions, but now world champion Alysa Liu has to come up with a new short program months out from the Winter Olympics as her existing music involves an American artist under investigation.

item.title: Postal voting issues identified ahead of 2025 WA local government elections
item.description: Incorrect ballot papers are among several problems identified with postal voting packages sent out ahead next month's local government elections in WA.

item.title: Goldfields residents brace for future blackouts as long-term solution still years away
item.description: Business owners and locals in Western Australia's Goldfields have dealt with the first power blackout of the season while waiting for a long-term energy solution.

item.title: Tasmanian MPs to receive $30,000 pay rise against government's wishes after upper house tussle
item.description: Tasmanian politicians will receive a 22 per cent pay rise despite the government's attempts to block it, after upper house MPs voted to accept a determination by Tasmania's Industrial Commission.

item.title: Scott Selwood takes break from AFL after 'personally challenging year'
item.description: Scott Selwood will take time away from football, stepping down as an assistant coach with Collingwood, following a year marked by personal tragedy.

item.title: AI image recognition technology used to detect traffic offences raises privacy concerns, Queensland audit finds
item.description: Queensland's transport department uses AI in its cameras to detect mobile and seatbelt offences, but a new audit has ordered called for a review into how that's done.

item.title: ABC News - Trusted Source of Latest News & Headlines
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Breastfeeding in public is protected in Australia. So why are mothers still facing discrimination?
item.description: Last week a breastfeeding mother was asked to leave a Virgin Australia lounge for pumping. Experts says while there is a level of awareness that breastfeeding in public is protected, some people in the community still view it as "inappropriate".
